options.name: Fungal Adept
options.description: You have dedicated yourself to the study of fungal cultivation and spore manipulation. Gain +1 skill with biosculpting.

options.name: Potent Spores
options.description: Your spores are exceptionally virulent. Gain +1 toxic mitigation. Required checks for your spore effects are increased by 2.

options.name: Magical Influence
options.description: Your knowledge of magic allows you to influence the way spores behave. Gain +1 skill with magic. Additionally, when you make a biosculpting check while using a sporecraft recipe, add a single magic knowledge dice to the pool.

options.name: Fungal Exposure
options.description: Your constant exposure to spores has made you especially resistant to affects. Gain +1 skill with endurance. Additionally, when you make a check against any spore cloud or similar effect, your contested check is doubled.

options.name: Reaction: Concentrated Release
options.description: When an adjacent creature attacks you, you release spores directly onto them. The attacker must immediately make a check against one spore infusion of your choice with a penalty die. The radius and duration of the spores are ignored.

options.name: Action: Controlled Release
options.description: You release spores in a cone instead of a cloud with a size equal to the radius. You can choose whether or not to include yourself within that area.

options.name: Master Sporekeeper
options.description: Your mastery of sporecraft is unmatched. Gain +1 skill with biosculpting. Your spore clouds last 1 additional round and have an extra 1 unit of radius.

options.name: Necrofungus
options.description: You can cultivate spores from undead corpses. Gain +1 skill with black magic. Standard undead corpses count as Tier 2 fungus and champion undead corpses count as Tier 3 fungus when harvesting, but the corpse is consumed in the process.

options.name: Primal Mycology
options.description: You can cultivate spores from beast corpses. Gain +1 skill with primal magic. Standard beast corpses count as Tier 2 fungus and champion beast corpses count as Tier 3 fungus when harvesting, but the corpse is consumed in the process.

options.name: Action: Sporeshift
options.description: You manipulate an existing spore cloud, moving it through the air. Choose a spore cloud within short (10 unit) range and a number of units to move it. Make either a black magic or primal magic check with a required check equal to the number of units you wish to move the cloud. On success, the cloud moves that many units in any direction.
